conclusion: Figure 1 shows a sine-like shape with adjacent crests at x ≈ 1 m and x ≈ 5 m, so the wavelength λ = 4 m.
Figure 2 shows successive crests at t ≈ 0.5 s and 4.5 s, giving the period T = 4 s.
In Figure 1, the particle at x = 2 m is on the equilibrium line (y = 0) moving upward.
Figure 2 shows it will reach its positive maximum at t ≈ 0.5 s after t = 2 s.
To make that happen, the crest that is currently at x = 1 m must be travelling toward x = 2 m, i.e. toward +x.
The wave propagates in the +x direction.
v = λ / T = 4 m / 4 s = 1 m·s⁻¹.
Propagation direction: along the +x axis (to the right).
